dict.string: The ability to auto tag items and add them via a URL scheme

# AutoTagger
For more info check out the repo: https://github.com/jangelsb/auto-tagger-alfred-workflow
## ğŸ“– Installation
### Step 1: Set up your Tags ```yaml work ğŸ“: - work - ios - pr
review ğŸ‘€: - pr - doc - review
Card ğŸ’¡: - create card
Important ğŸ”º: - '!!'
```
### Step 2: Set up your URL Schemes ```yaml - title: "Add to inbox ğŸ“¥" url: sorted://x-callback-url/add?title=[query]&tags=[tags]&date=[today]
- title: "Add to admin ğŸ“" url: sorted://x-callback-url/add?title=[query]&tags=[tags]&date=[today]&list=%F0%9F%93%81%20Admin
- title: "Search in SortedÂ³" url: sorted://x-callback-url/open?search=[query] icon: search.png
```
**Dyanmic variables:** - `[query]` - `[tags]` - `[today]`
**Built in icons:** - `tags.png` - `search.png`
---
## ğŸ“ Version History
#### v2025.4 * Cleaned up workflow configuration to reference the readme * Fixed typos
---
#### v2025.3 * Fixed issue with tags auto completing * Removed subtitle for items in script filter * Tweak how tags look in the UI * Minor clean up
---
#### v2025.2 Now you can have multiple url schemes and see found tags in line!
* Changed workflow to use a script filter * Added support for multiple url schemes in a yaml config * Added some icons
---
#### v2025.1 This is the initial release.
The workflow defaults to working with SortedÂ³ out of the box, but it can be customized to use any URL scheme ğŸ˜Š
It allows you to
* specify the tags and related terms in an inline yaml config * specify the URL scheme with dynamic placeholders [title], [tags], [today] the keyword * Tags are added based on the items show up in the query. URLs are ignored.
Type this phrase to add items

work ğŸ“: - work - ios - pr
review ğŸ‘€: - pr - doc - review
Card ğŸ’¡: - create card
Important ğŸ”º: - '!!'

This a yaml config of tags, where each tag has a list of items that represent the tag
See example in Step 1 ğŸ‘‰

- title: Add to Inbox ğŸ“¥ url: sorted://x-callback-url/add?title=[query]&tags=[tags]&date=[today]
- title: "Search in SortedÂ³" url: sorted://x-callback-url/open?search=[query] icon: search.png

This a yaml config of url schemes, where each item has a title, url, and (optional) icon path.
See example in Step 2 ğŸ‘‰
